intro: Balanoplis serrata, commonly known as the serrated balanoplis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have serrated edges, giving it its common name. Balanoplis serrata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
